item.title: By: Tom Bloodgood
item.dc:creator: Tom Bloodgood
item.content:encoded:
There was some controversy back a few years ago on Al’Kabor (the one and only Mac server) that involved a professional baseball player getting a server transfer with his level 60 character to or from the Mac server although not a single Mac user was allowed to transfer to another server nor was any PC user who now played on his or her Mac allowed to transfer a character over.

I just remember it because I thought it was pretty crappy that it could happen, but money is what makes the world go round.

(Assuming the board is still up, was where I heard about it.)

item.title: By: Troggdor
item.dc:creator: Troggdor
item.description: Schilling is widely known to be a fan of gaming in general (he owns a wargames company i beleive). Also he was an avid player of the original Everquest and i'm sure an avid player of EQ2.
item.content:encoded: Schilling is widely known to be a fan of gaming in general (he owns a wargames company i beleive). Also he was an avid player of the original Everquest and i’m sure an avid player of EQ2.

item.title: By: Finster
item.dc:creator: Finster
item.description: Curt Schilling? Weird. And in the picture, he's wearing some weird t-shirt... hat... it doesn't look like he was paid to attend... does not compute...
item.content:encoded: Curt Schilling? Weird. And in the picture, he’s wearing some weird t-shirt… hat… it doesn’t look like he was paid to attend… does not compute…
